page.title: 09Employment in St. Agnes
page.content: Since St. Agnes is a tourist resort, albeit of a quiet kind, many jobs are seasonal and linked with tourism. The small shops; the hotels, restaurants and guest houses; and the public houses all employ local people, many on a part-time or casual basis. A number of local men work at Teagles agricultural factory (in an adjacent "block"). Local farmers and market gardeners employ a few agricultural workers. Many men travel further afield to work in tin mines in the Camborne/Redruth area, following in the footsteps of their grandfathers - in whose time St. Agnes was a wealthy mining area. Many females travel to Truro to work in offices or as staff in hospitals. Numerous nursing homes in St. Agnes absorb a considerable number of both men and women.
